the scanner oscillates about uh 25 times

450,000 measurements per second those

something like this and the billions of

off the planet in all directions two or
3% of of the signal that it's emitted
comes back to the sensor how long is
that journey 1,200 m divided by the
speed of light and like you know it's
it's it's very very small fractions of a
second now the key to all of this is
that even though the Maya forest looks

the photons slip through the cracks in

and bounce off the ground if you have
hiked around you sometimes see like you
know the the sun will come through
certain gaps in the canopy so basically
what we're doing with lighter is that we
use an an artificial sun and we move it

trying to see like where are those gaps
and how we can hit the ground if they
send 15 pulses for each square meter of

sometimes none of them do at most maybe

the reward for all that effort is a
point
cloud each point here is a laser return

they can
